channel.title: Editing/Creating Movements/Emotes. (How To?)
channel.description:
Wasn't quite sure 'where to put this', and I narrowed the decision down to here, or Server Tutorials "Request Here". Needless to say, i arrived at the decision to post it here.
I'm completely new to coding. The most I've done is code text spewed from NPC's, and failed at that miserably. But I have about 3-4 Months, and i want to take that time to learn how to create/edit movements/emotes.
I've used the search button, so please do not scrutenise me on that, although I will allow you to mock me for the spelling mistake in this sentance, (If you do so please.) and haven't found Jack... Crud... And came up with nothing.
Simply: I am asking for a tutorial link, or a tutorial on how to create emotes. And any flame will fall upon deaf ears, unless it is MORE helpful THAN hurtful. ("n00b, just search it up, here's a link i faownd" = horrible. "You're new to java? Well good luck, anyway, link is as follows:..." = Meh "Link = <here>" = Pownage.)
Please, but more importantly thank you, for providing me with this information.

item.title: Editing/Creating Movements/Emotes. (How To?)
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

Teh Moose:

I’d use delta’s, its easy to get and pretty generic as far as clients go.

He can’t. Delta’s client is a non-renamed and he needs a refractored client.

Read full topic

item.title: Editing/Creating Movements/Emotes. (How To?)
item.dc:creator: @WickedMalice WickedMalice
item.description:
@WickedMalice wrote:

There we go, thank you. I suppose about a few days with messing around with it will get me used to it. Do you have a reccommended server source to test this? (I have a no-ip, but no BiTorrent, and I have JDK 5.)

I know how to make a server, that’s simple, but I messed with my java thing, so now whenever I hit “Run Server” It sends some error like: “Javat” is not a correct command, or whatever. And if you could just answer one question - how do you add a new “frame”? And is there a way to tell what frame rate the emote will play out at? I’m more used to 20-40.

Thanks, again.

Read full topic

item.title: Editing/Creating Movements/Emotes. (How To?)
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

Assumed Knowledge: Understanding of basic java.

Files/Classes Modified: Animation.java

For RENAMED Clients

Procedure
Go to Animation.java, and add this before the end of the method unpackConfig().

anims[3840] = new Animation();
anims[3840].anInt352 = 1; // The length of the animation. (In frames) Any longer than its correct length will throw an exception.
anims[3840].anInt356 = -1; // Appears not needed.
anims[3840].aBoolean358 = true;
anims[3840].anInt359 = 5;
anims[3840].anInt360 = -1; // The item you're holding in your shield slot when you do emote, don't know how the hell you get these ids.
anims[3840].anInt361 = -1;
anims[3840].anInt362 = 99;
anims[3840].anInt363 = -1;
anims[3840].anInt364 = -1;
anims[3840].anInt365 = -1;
anims[3840].anIntArray355 = new int[999];
anims[3840].anIntArray354 = new int[999];
anims[3840].anIntArray353 = new int[999]; // The frames the animation does. This is a crucial array, as I can combine/edit any animation I wish.
anims[3840].anIntArray353[0] = 0;

Also, change:

anims = new Animation[length];

to:

anims = new Animation[length+20];

Now. The above code, if you called the emote 3840, would simply do the frame 0, then end the animation.

This is shown by this:

anims[3840].anIntArray353[0] = 0; // The first frame being called. In this instance, the frame is 0, stand still with your legs together.

If I wanted another frame, I would add another part of the array.

anims[3840].anIntArray353[1] = 1337; // The second frame being called. In this instance, the frame is 1337

You can dump the ids with a simple for loop in unpackConfig().

for(int i = 0; i < anims[1658].anIntArray353.length; i++) {
    System.out.println("1658: "+anims[1658].anIntArray353[i]);
}

Read full topic

item.title: Editing/Creating Movements/Emotes. (How To?)
item.dc:creator: @WickedMalice WickedMalice
item.description:
@WickedMalice wrote:

Err, thanks, but I was more wondering how to create/edit movements/emotes.

:\ I kind of knew all that other st00f, And was wondering how to make movements. IE:

Make an emote where a guy… Err… Points in the sky, or whatever. That’s what I was talking about. I know there’s a way, but not quite sure how, since again I’m new to Java.

Plus… I don’t have any type of server, or source - I figured I can’t make one at all… I screwed up with stuff, and it just won’t work out quite right now. I’m moving on to other types of game-making programs. But, I figure if I learn to code Java well (Movements), I can make some money selling some emotes to private server owners.

It’s okay if you can’t help. And I catch onto things really quick, and I’m quite a fast learner, so don’t be afraid to show me some complexe sh-… Stuff…

Read full topic

item.title: Editing/Creating Movements/Emotes. (How To?)
item.dc:creator: @Teh_Moose Teh Moose
item.description:
@Teh_Moose wrote:

Ok first, heres the button id’s for the emotes, these are the cases youll need to put in your client.java in order to allow players to perform emotes… Emote (No): 169 Emote (Think): 162 Emote (Bow): 164 Emote (Angry): 165 Emote (Cry): 161 Emote (Laugh): 170 Emote (Cheer): 171 Emote (Wave): 163 Emote (Beckon): 167 Emote (Clap): 172 Emote (Dance): 166 Emote (Panic): 52050 Emote (Jig): 52051 Emote (Spin): 52052 Emote (Head Bang): 52053 Emote (Joy Jump): 52054 Emote (Rasp'berry): 52055 Emote (Yawn): 52056 Emote (Salute): 52057 Emote (Shrug): 52058 Emote (Blow Kiss): 43092 Emote (Glass Box): 2155 Emote (Climb Rope): 25103 Emote (Lean): 25106 Emote (Glass Wall): 2154 Emote (Goblin Bow): 52071 Emote (Goblin Dance): 52072 Emote (Scared): 59062

Next…
Go into your client.java
Then find where your emotions are, mine happen to be teleports on this server
So, to make the clap emote teleport you to slayer I have…

case 172: if (teleblock == true) { sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting."); } else { customCommand("slayer"); } break;
Now since you want them to do an emotion when you click the button youd change that to…

case 172: startAnimation(865); } break;
This would make the clap button do the clap emote
Now I’ll List the emote ID’s so all you’ll have to do is match the button ID with the emote ID

855 - Yes 856 - No 857 - Thinking 858 - Bow 859 - Angry 860 - Cry 861 - Laugh 862 - Cheer 863 - Wave 864 - Beckon 865 - Clap 866 - Dance 2105 - panic emote 2106 - slow jig emote 2107 - spin emote 2108 - headbang emote 2109 - joy jump emote 2110 - rasp' berry emote 2111 - yawn emote 2112 - salute emote 2113 - shrug emote 1128 - GLASS WALL - MIME 1129 - LEAN - MIME 1130 - CLIMB ROPE - MIME 1131 - GLASS BOX - MIME
Now if you want them emote buttons to say the emote you’ll have to go into your texthandler.java and know the text slot ID’s
I don’t remember the specifics but I know that these are all emote name spaces in your textahandler.java

p.sendFrame126("", 180); p.sendFrame126("@whi@Train", 181); p.sendFrame126("@red@Veng", 178); p.sendFrame126("@whi@Shops", 175); p.sendFrame126("@red@ PK", 177); p.sendFrame126("@red@PKBox", 185); p.sendFrame126("@gre@Barrow", 186); p.sendFrame126("@red@ KQ", 173); p.sendFrame126("@red@ Jad", 179); p.sendFrame126("@gre@Slayer", 187); p.sendFrame126("@whi@Skills", 176); p.sendFrame126("@red@ KBD", 13371); p.sendFrame126("", 13372); p.sendFrame126("", 13373); p.sendFrame126("", 13374); p.sendFrame126("", 13376); p.sendFrame126("", 13378); p.sendFrame126("", 13380); p.sendFrame126("", 13381); p.sendFrame126("", 13382); p.sendFrame126("", 11102); p.sendFrame126("", 13379); p.sendFrame126("", 13377); p.sendFrame126("", 13375); p.sendFrame126("", 11103); p.sendFrame126("@whi@Walk", 160); p.sendFrame126("@whi@Run", 159);
Hope this helped, just made it all for you its not leeched or anything lol

Read full topic
